column1:
Speed_champions_fan,"2017-03-05T07:10:43.7Z","A great polybag, especially if it's free!","

I got this along with the volcano polybag for free at smyths in a promotion. I must say this is my favourite (although I am a huge car nerd so that could possibly affect it).

As for the minifigures, there is only one: a rather casual-looking gentleman with beige trousers, a white shirt, what looks like a denim jacket and silver sunglasses. It's a common head, but a useful one as it is adequately generic. He also has medium-long, black hair with a fringe brushed over to one side. All in it's a great generic figure

The build is simple, but, at just a few minutes, it's too short to get boring. A 7 stud long car base is used, and the rear is attached with SNOT but really there's nothing special. The traffic light is also a very simple build. There are a few useful parts, including the wheelarches and the large black bracket.
On the whole, this is one of my favourite polybags, it's a great car, as city cars using this base tend to be. I would recommend it to anyone who can get their hands on it.

,TRUE,5,4,2,4,5 Odeinoichus","2017-08-23T16:26:25.843Z","Sporting Along in nice Cool Blue colours","

Set #30349 Sports Car: Here’s another LEGO City Polybag, typical of LEGO City it offers up a single persona and a small little vehicle of some sort. The following review will cover the pros and cons of the set and then finish off by saying if you should track one down or not.
Pros:

column2: Sports car model is very quick and easy to build and has an overall fun design. Reminiscent of the racing cars of the past. Colour choice is also quite sharp with dark blue primary colouring.
Minifigure is decent looking for a Polybag set. Hair piece most unique looking sculpt in use.
Additional Street Light model missing middle light, works more as a starting light for a race. Or could be MOCed into a better more functional design.

column1: Cons:

column2: Price-per-parts ratio is decent, though not perfect. Feels as if too few parts for 5$ asking price.
Car model seems more like a go-kart design, could have used a few more pieces to bulk it up.
Does not include any accessories for the driver.

column1: Overall opinion

Not a terrible LEGO City Polybag. It’s a nice reprieve from the onslaught of Police vehicles or Fire Rescue sets that continue to show up. And the colouring of the model is very sharp, I love the deep blues used here as opposed to some of the others.

I got this on sale via an online purchase with Toy’s-R-Us, I’d say it’s worth tracking down if it can be bought for a good price. LEGO City Polybags are always worth picking up, just not always worth the full asking price. Recommended.

The building experience was not there for the blocky car. The parts were not good, and the playability comes from the car. The price is ok, but goes to meh due to there being better cars for the same price.
